newsitem.title: USA: CBOT corn seen 1/2-one cent up on exports, demand.
newsitem.headline: CBOT corn seen 1/2-one cent up on exports, demand.

text.p: CBOT corn futures are expected to open 1/2 to one cent per bushel higher Thursday on solid weekly export sales data and overnight export demand, traders said.
The U.S. Department of Agriculture put net weekly export corn sales at 593,200 tonnes. That figure came in at the high end of trade expectations for 450,000 to 600,000 tonnes.
Overnight export demand for U.S. corn from Asia will also help lift prices on the open, traders said.
South Korea is tendering for 105,000 tonnes of U.S. corn for July/September shipment, and Taiwan bought 54,000 tonnes of U.S. corn for July shipment.
